str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Elymas, the name of the sorcerer at Paphos. Of foreign origin; Elymas, a wizard.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sorcerer, a magician, a wizard. Of foreign origin; a Magian, i.e. Oriental scientist; by implication, a magician.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To translate (from one language into another), interpret. From meta and hermeneuo; to explain over, i.e. Translate.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To set against; I withstand, resist, oppose. From anti and histemi; to stand against, i.e. Oppose.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.
To pervert, corrupt, oppose, distort. From dia and strepho; to distort, i.e. misinterpret, or corrupt.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A proconsul. From anti and a superlative of huper; instead of the highest officer, i.e. a Roman proconsul.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
